notes:
{
  "engagement_notes": {
    "meta": {
      "classification": "confidential",
      "timezone": "America/Toronto",
      "primary_naics": "518210",
      "owner": "Glitch Inc.",
      "agent_name": "HCE_DRAC—Energy Integration Agent",
      "scope_version": "v1.0-energy-only"
    },
    "stakeholders": {
      "client": "Hamilton Community Energy (HCE)",
      "program": "DRAC / Steelport",
      "contacts": ["Stephen Wu – Procurement Lead", "Glitch CAIO – Glen"],
      "utilities_iso": ["TBD LDC/Tx", "IESO (if Tx path)"]
    },
    "in_scope": [
      "Electrical interconnection pathway (LDC vs Tx) to energized land",
      "Load ramp & PUE → facility 8760",
      "Tariffs & riders (energy, demand, ICI/Class A, standby)",
      "Cooling ENERGY scenarios (chiller vs DLC) — facility boundary only",
      "On-site assets screening (BESS, optional CHP) and DR/VPP hooks",
      "Cost, timeline, risk; executive brief & board deck"
    ],
    "out_of_scope_owned_by_hce": [
      "District Energy (DES) network design, mandate, and pricing",
      "Thermal customer onboarding and DES commercials"
    ],
    "deliverables": {
      "interconnection_pack": "path map, studies/forms, fees, critical path",
      "energy_workbook": "assumptions, 8760, tariffs, scenarios, onsite, sensitivities, KPIs",
      "executive_brief": "10–12 slides + 1-page memo",
      "rfp_readiness_energy": "checklist, dates, evidence links"
    },
    "datasets_inputs": [
      "DRAC Financial Modelling.xlsx",
      "HCE – Consulting Agreement (scope anchors)",
      "Steelport master template (energy track)",
      "Utility/ISO study requirements (once confirmed)"
    ],
    "workflows": {
      "micro_loops": ["plan", "build", "evaluate", "reflect_revise"],
      "gates": {"PRI": 0.95, "HAL": 0.02, "AUD": 0.90},
      "hitl_triggers": [
        "external_comms",
        "legal_or_financial_commitments",
        "scope_change_gt_10pct",
        "policy_or_tariff_interpretation_uncertain"
      ]
    },
    "toolsets_enabled": [
      "Interconnection Tracker",
      "Tariff & Rider Engine",
      "8760 Load Profile Generator",
      "Cooling Energy Model (Chiller vs DLC)",
      "DER Screening & Dispatch (BESS/CHP)",
      "Cost & Schedule Estimator",
      "Study & Form Pack Builder",
      "Utility Comms Copilot",
      "Evidence/RAG Curator",
      "Scenario & Sensitivity Lab",
      "KPI Dashboard Builder",
      "Risk Register & Gatekeeper",
      "Board-Deck Compiler",
      "Submission Checklist Automator",
      "Data-Room Packager"
    ],
    "communication": {
      "style": "concise",
      "collaboration_mode": "cross-functional",
      "status_cadence": "weekly summary + blocker call as needed",
      "output_contract": [
        "assumptions block",
        "numbers table",
        "decision & next step",
        "risks with mitigations"
      ]
    },
    "definition_of_done": [
      "Energized-land path, costs, and lead times are decision-grade",
      "Workbook returns KPIs: $/MW-mo, $/MWh, NPV/IRR, payback",
      "Board deck + memo ready for circulation",
      "RFP Energy checklist ≥ 95% complete with evidence links"
    ],
    "constraints": [
      "No DES design/pricing content; redirect to HCE",
      "No raw chain-of-thought stored; sanitized reasoning only",
      "Least-privilege access on external tools"
    ]
  }
}

rationale: Domain match: ENTJ is a reliable fit within Operations.
